content:
That's wonderful! It's great that you've found a local art studio with a good instructor like Rachel. Having a hands-on learning experience with a knowledgeable teacher can make all the difference in developing your skills and confidence.

It's also excellent that you've been experimenting with different clays and materials in your classes. Getting familiar with the feel and behavior of various clays is essential in creating unique textures and forms. Rachel's guidance has likely helped you develop a solid foundation in working with clay, and now you're ready to take it to the next level by exploring mixed media techniques.

Remember to continue practicing and experimenting with new materials and techniques. Don't be afraid to try new things and make mistakes – they're an essential part of the learning process. And don't hesitate to reach out to Rachel or online resources if you have questions or need guidance.

Also, consider sharing your work and progress with others, whether it's through social media, online forums, or local art communities. Getting feedback and support from fellow artists can be incredibly motivating and help you stay inspired.

Keep up the great work, and I'm sure you'll continue to grow as a sculptor!
